title: Kintsugi
intro: Mending a broken teapot and in turn my own broken heart over the fragility of my precious brewer.

title: Aquarelle
intro: Got inspired by the wonderous flows of water colors and tried my hand at faking the effect in software. This takes a lot of inspiration from tylerxhobbs nicely written blog on the subject.

title: C20
intro: The third day of Genuary 2024 became and homage to the train that has taken me basically everywhere I have wanted to go. SL:s lovely C20, may you roll on forever.

title: Fassett
intro: For the second day of Genuary 2024 I got inspired by a lovely pattern sample from Kaffe Fassett and tried to make procedural tiling patterns and paletts.

title: Patricles
intro: For the first day of Genuary 2024 I created a Lorentz attractor using blenders simulation nodes.

title: Singalingo
intro: I have recently started singing in a very amature-ish choir and wanted some way of learning musical notation etc. To this end me and a colegue of mine built this website for learning to sing.

title: Virtual kinetic sculpture
intro: A colegue of mine wanted to rebuild a fantastic kinetic sculpture as a hackathon project. I helped him out with visualizing it using blender geometry nodes.

title: 3d printed shoes?!
intro: Inspired by a 3d printing conference my job sent me to and the fancy Zellerfeld shoes I got to try there I tried to design my own shoes using my 3d scanned feet and blender geometry nodes for printing on an Artillery Sidewinder X2 printer.

title: Goon Quest
intro: Another GMTK game jam another shitty game. This time sound effects was one of the things I got the most distracted by, so please play with sound on.

title: Game of light
intro: Learning about the new simulations nodes in Blender 3.6 by messing around with a hexagonal game of life.

title: Habit tracker
intro: Got a bit curious to learn rust after i realized I could do full stack applications fully in it. My first experiment is building a habit tracker.

title: Hamlight
intro: Building a luminous Hamlet to keep my idea lamp some company and to learn about how to work with clay.

title: Jazz-GPT
intro: Trying desperatley to stay with the times I colaborated with chat-gpt to create a website for generative "jazz".

title: Teewee: the art exhibition
intro: This past week I have been doing one of my scariest projects as of yet; hosting an art exhibition at Konsthall C in lovely Hökarängen.

title: Hilbert curves and perlin noise
intro: Hilbert curves driven by some perlin noise in the browser

title: Brownian motion for plotter
intro: Experimenting with brownian motion based programs for my plotter to make it independent for my comming exhibtion at konsthall C:s centrifug

title: Genuary 2023
intro: Staring the year of in a good way by doing some prompts from Genuary in my favourite software - Blender.

title: Advent of procastination 2022
intro: Yet an other year I manage to distract myself from actually completing the puzzles. This time by trying (and arguably failing) to make the solutions into a "beutiful" website.

title: Animations galore!
intro: Messing around with CSS animations and mouse pointer tracking to do some silly animations right here on this website.

title: Cheap copies
intro: I was really intruiged by some NFT art works displayed at the photograhic museum in stockholm so I tried to recreate them in blender.

title: Dice rolling game
intro: GMTK:s game jam with the theme "roll the dice" was just the excuse I needed to learn some game development in Godot

title: En krokus, flera kroki
intro: Using my growing proficiency in blender to illustrate a weird pun in swedish

title: Geometry nodes galore
intro: I have been making some animations in Blender using the new geometry nodes in 3.0. These have been inspired by the first few prompts from Genuary 2022.

title: Line plotter robot
intro: Building a little line driven plotter robot from some steppers and old lego as well writing a few different algorithms for converting images to plotter paths.

title: My first blender render!
intro: I just completed my first blender tutorial and was really excited with the resulting bowl of apples. Despite or maybe, because of, its many flaws.

title: Python poetry
intro: I was embarrassingly proud of some of my solutions to this years advent of code puzzles. Pretentiously I call them "python poetry"

title: Scope face
intro: Showing a webcam feed on a oscilloscope screen by converting it to terrible sound

title: Lamps
intro: Making me some lamps to bring more light into my new apartment

title: Swapping images
intro: Making it possible to swap between multiple images on this site

title: Project Narcissus
intro: Feeding my inner narcissist by training a VAE to generate (chockingly bad) "selfies" of myself

title: Dead bug color organ
intro: A dead bug style analog color organ built to combat the boredom of quarantine

title: Folding desk
intro: A home built folding desk/tv shelf for these trying times and more

title: Playlist from chat history
intro: A very quick and dirty hack to make a Spotify playlist from all the songs mentioned in a facebook chat

title: This very website
intro: Continuing to learn frontend by building myself a little portfolio page

title: Sju års lycka
intro: Performing (very mild) civil disobedience by decorating a subway station with mirrors

title: CPPN
intro: Generative art implemented in tensorflowJS

title: Worst raytracer
intro: Building the worlds worst raytracer from scratch in Python
